<<<code>>>: You can use the following code to disable the button and change the text when the app is first opened on a tablet:
```
@Override
public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
    Button myButton = (Button) findViewById(R.id.my_button);
    myButton.setEnabled(false);
    myButton.setText("Disabled Button");
}
```
This code will set the button's enabled state to false and change the text to "Disabled Button" when the activity is created.

You can also use the following code to check if the device is a tablet or phone before enabling or disabling the button:
```
@Override
public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    if(isTablet()){
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
        Button myButton = (Button) findViewById(R.id.my_button);
        myButton.setEnabled(false);
        myButton.setText("Disabled Button");
    }else{
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
        Button myButton = (Button) findViewById(R.id.my_button);
        myButton.setEnabled(true);
        myButton.setText("Call");
    }
}

private boolean isTablet(){
    // Check if the device is a tablet or phone
    return (getResources().getConfiguration().screenLayout == 1) && (getResources().getConfiguration().screenSize == 1);
}
```
This code will check if the device is a tablet or phone using the `isTablet()` method and enable or disable the button accordingly.

Note that you need to define the `isTablet()` method to check if the device is a tablet or phone. You can use the `getResources().getConfiguration().screenLayout` and `getResources().getConfiguration().screenSize` to check the layout and size of the device's screen.
